messages: 59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (17:48): How do i make a virtual interface that i can attach rules to. Like the VLAN interfaces ??
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (18:11): no, no... i wrote like
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (18:31): Rawplayer, still serious about the vconfig
13fbb6cc9f88ccfc50845bb81132b4d4 (18:32): Weasel[DK]: looking for tun interfaces ?
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (18:34): matth_, ahhh remember messing with those a long time a go... if iptables see it as a "real" interface it is ok.
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (18:36): i¥ll give it a try..
13fbb6cc9f88ccfc50845bb81132b4d4 (18:37): check Documentation/networking/tuntap.txt to see if that's what you're looking for (linux kernel tree)
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (18:38): ooops..  wrong window... ;9
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (18:56): matth_, does not seems like it... tun/tap interfaces are terminated in a user-space application.
13fbb6cc9f88ccfc50845bb81132b4d4 (18:58): that still answer your first question
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:01): probably... but i can't use it as a 'normal' interface.... forwarding etc.
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:01): which is possible vith VLAN interfaces
661186e835f2d517077443e282a4a42a (19:01): and get a vlan router
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:02): no no no
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:02): i need multiple ip in a single interface
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:03): do you want something like "ip addr add secondip/subnet dev interfacename"?
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:04): the box i want to replace have that.
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:04): why not just use that then?
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:06): i want iptables to see the aliased ip as interface that i can attach rules to.
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:06): not possible. Use -d to match on the IP
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:07): is ther something wrong with -d ?
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:07): It would be mouch easier to apply the rules
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:08): make a user-defined chain for each IP
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:08): Ahh, yes that could do the trick..
661186e835f2d517077443e282a4a42a (19:10): so each alias in each chain?
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:11): yes
de76c8e6cbbc3c1c44788a340cac141e (19:11): although I dislike the eth0:2 syntax...
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:14): i have been using 'filehol' for a long time... so i forgot some of my iptables knowlege
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:16): 'firehol' that is... ;)
59a4d81f213e985dd16f9aa8dd3985cd (19:35): thanks all... C U later
